NSString(NDCarbonUtilities)

Provides method for interacting with Carbon APIs.

Extends Class: NSString
Declared In: NSString+NDCarbonUtilities

Discussion

Methods for dealing with FSRef’s and pascal string as well as making some other core foundation methods accessable in Objective-C syntax.


Methods

-fileSystemPathHFSStyle

Returns a HFS style path.

-finderInfoFlags:type:creator:

Get finder info flags creator and type.

-finderLocation

Return a finder items location.

-getFSRef:

Get a FSRef for a path NSString.

-getFSSpec:

Get a FSSpec.

-getPascalString:length:

Obtain a pascal string equivelent to the receveiver.

-pascalString

Obtain a pascal string equivelent to the receveiver.

-pathFromFileSystemPathHFSStyle

Get a path from a HFS style path.

-resolveAliasFile

Resolve an alias file.

-setFinderInfoFlags:mask:type:creator:

Set finder info flags, creator and type.

-setFinderLocation:

Sets the location a finder item.

+stringWithFSRef:

Alloc and initialize an NSString.

+stringWithPascalString:

Alloc and initialize an NSString.

-trimWhitespace

Trims white space from a NSString.

fileSystemPathHFSStyle

Returns a HFS style path. 

- (NSString *)fileSystemPathHFSStyle;
Return Value

A new NSString containing a HFS style path for the same file or directory as the receiver.

Discussion

Returns a NSString containg a HFS style path (e.g. Macitosh HD:Users:) useful for display purposes.

finderInfoFlags:type:creator:

Get finder info flags creator and type. 

- (BOOL)finderInfoFlags:(UInt16*)flags type:(OSType*)type 
        creator:(OSType*)creator;
Parameters
flags

Contains finder flags on return.

type

Contains finder type on return.

creator

Contains creator on return.

Return Value

Return YES if successful, otherwise NO and the returned values are invalid.

Discussion

The bits of the finder info flag are

NameDescription
kIsOnDeskFiles and folders (System 6)
kColorFiles and folders
kIsSharedFiles only (Applications only)
If clear, the application needs to write to its resource fork, and therefore cannot be shared on a server
kHasNoINITsFiles only (Extensions/Control Panels only)
This file contains no INIT resource
kHasBeenInitedFiles only
Clear if the file contains desktop database resources ('BNDL', 'FREF', 'open', 'kind'...) that have not been added yet. Set only by the Finder
kHasCustomIconFiles and folders
kIsStationeryFiles only
kNameLockedFiles and folders
kHasBundleFiles only
kIsInvisibleFiles and folders
kIsAliasFiles only.

finderLocation

Return a finder items location. 

- (NSPoint)finderLocation;
Return Value

A NSPoint

Discussion

Returns a finder items location within its parent window.

getFSRef:

Get a FSRef for a path NSString. 

- (BOOL)getFSRef:(FSRef *)fsRef;
Parameters
fsRef

a pointer to a FSRef.

Return Value

Return YES if the method was successful, if the function returns NO then the FSRef pointed to by fsRef is garbage.

Discussion

Initializes an FSRef for a POSIX style path NSString.

getFSSpec:

Get a FSSpec.

Deprecated:

in version 10.5

- (BOOL)getFSSpec:(FSSpec *)fsSpec;
Parameters
fsSpec

A pointer to a FSSpec struct, to be filled by the method.

Return Value

Returns YES if successful, if the method returns NO then fsSpec contains garbage.

Discussion

Obtain a FSSpec for a POSIX path.

Availability
Introduced in Mac OS X v10.2, and deprecated in Mac OS X v10.2.

getPascalString:length:

Obtain a pascal string equivelent to the receveiver. 

- (BOOL)getPascalString:(StringPtr)buffer length:(short)length;
Parameters
buffer

A StringPtr that contains the pascal string on completion.

length

The maximum length the string can be. Pascal string can be no longer than 255 bytes long, 256 if you include the first length byte.

Return Value

Returns YES if the method was successful, if NO is returns then buffer contains garbage.

Discussion

Fill the StringPtr with a pascal string equivelent to the receveiver.

pascalString

Obtain a pascal string equivelent to the receveiver.

Deprecated:

in version 10.5

- (const char *)pascalString;
Return Value

A pointer to a pascal string.

Discussion

Returns a representation of the receiver as a pascal string. The returned pascal string will be automatically freed just as a returned object would be released; your code should copy the pascal string or use getPascalString:length: if it needs to store the pascal string outside of the autorelease context in which the pascal string is created. Do not use this method in a Garbage Collected application, it has undefined behaviour!

Availability
Introduced in Mac OS X v10.2, and deprecated in Mac OS X v10.2.

pathFromFileSystemPathHFSStyle

Get a path from a HFS style path. 

- (NSString *)pathFromFileSystemPathHFSStyle;
Return Value

A NSString containing a POSIX style path.

Discussion

pathFromFileSystemPathHFSStyle returns a POSIX style path from a HFS style path.

resolveAliasFile

Resolve an alias file. 

- (NSString *)resolveAliasFile;
Return Value

An POSIX path NSString.

Discussion

Returns an POSIX path NSString refered to by the receveive if the receveive refers to an alias file. If it does not refer to an alias file the a string identical to the receveive is returned.

setFinderInfoFlags:mask:type:creator:

Set finder info flags, creator and type. 

- (BOOL)setFinderInfoFlags:(UInt16)flags mask:(UInt16)aMask 
        type:(OSType)type creator:(OSType)creator;
Parameters
flags

Finder flags.

aMask

Mask for Finder flags

type

The Finder file type

creator

The application creator code

Return Value

Returns YES if successful.

Discussion

The bits of the finder info flag are

NameDescription
kIsOnDeskFiles and folders (System 6)
kColorFiles and folders
kIsSharedFiles only (Applications only)
If clear, the application needs to write to its resource fork, and therefore cannot be shared on a server
kHasNoINITsFiles only (Extensions/Control Panels only)
This file contains no INIT resource
kHasBeenInitedFiles only
Clear if the file contains desktop database resources ('BNDL', 'FREF', 'open', 'kind'...) that have not been added yet. Set only by the Finder
kHasCustomIconFiles and folders
kIsStationeryFiles only
kNameLockedFiles and folders
kHasBundleFiles only
kIsInvisibleFiles and folders
kIsAliasFiles only.

setFinderLocation:

Sets the location a finder item. 

- (BOOL)setFinderLocation:(NSPoint)location;
Parameters
location

The location

Return Value

Returns YES if successful.

Discussion

Set the location of a finder item within in container.

stringWithFSRef:

Alloc and initialize an NSString. 

+ (NSString *)stringWithFSRef:(const FSRef *)fsRef;
Parameters
fsRef

a pointer to a FSRef.

Return Value

A NSString containing a POSIX path.

Discussion

Creats a NSString containing a POSIX style path from a FSRef

stringWithPascalString:

Alloc and initialize an NSString. 

+ (NSString *)stringWithPascalString:(ConstStr255Param)pStr;
Parameters
pStr

A pascal string of type ConstStr255Param.

Return Value

A NSString.

Discussion

Reurns a new NSString equivelent to the passed in pascal string.

trimWhitespace

Trims white space from a NSString. 

- (NSString *)trimWhitespace;
Return Value

A new NSString.

Discussion

Returns a new NSString equivelent to the receveiver but without any white space (return, new line, space, tab) at the begining or end of the string.
